result.execSummary:
The defendant Owen A. Masters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample 10-7-16.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only as prescribed and as approved by agent.
No contact with known drug users, drug sellers or places known where drugs are sold.
No contact with anyone on probation or extended supervision for a drug offense.
No contact with K.S. if on probation for drug offense; if so, only as approved by agent.

Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.
Undergo assessments, treatments and counseling as recommended by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Owen A. Masters in court with attorney Jane C.W. Hansen.  Defendant Owen A. Masters in custody.  Allen R Brey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:59am
Atty Hansen spks on PSI corrections
DA spks on sentencing
Atty Hansens spks on sentencing
Court imposes:
3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision. Consecutive to any other sentence. 74 days credit. Eligible for SAP. Not eligible for CIP.
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Pay costs & fees
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent
No contact with known drug users, drug sellers, or places known where drugs are sold
No contact with anyone on probation or extended supervision for a drug offense. No contact with Katie Saunier if on probation for drug offense- is so, only as approved by agent.
Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment; or part-time employment if enrolled in school. Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Def must give DNA sample today
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Appeal rights
